"Nobody is going to call me and say, "Hey, I want you to come and do halftime at the Super Bowl," says the poet, a huge football fan who once taught Michael Vick . But we'd ask Janet Jackson . When we look at poetry we have to say,` This is where we're at'... Poetry sits atop this pyramid, and we have given birth to another aspect of it when we look at rap and spoken word. Poetry also has a distinct advantage in an age of tweets and sound-bites. "The brevity of a poem allows for the kind of fast-paced world we"re in," Major Jackson says. "

his perspective as Pentagon chief under then-president George W Bush. Donald Rumsfeld was regarded as the chief architect of the war in Iraq.
